intro: Restio macer, commonly known as the slender restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family, which includes many grass-like plants adapted to fire-prone environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Due to its resilience and unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
